quote: One of the best programming skills you can have is knowing when to walk away for awhile.
author: Oscar Godson

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute. - What will the code look like when read by a human? Can you understand it? Does it communicate its intent clearly?
author: Harold Abelson

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, itâ€™s bad. - Writing clean, self-explanatory code is an art. Good code communicates its purpose without the need for extensive comments or explanations.
author: Cory House

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user. - Ultimately, a successful program is one that fulfills its purpose and satisfies the needs of its users.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: Software, like a gas, expands to fill its container. - Without clear design and architecture, software systems tend to become overly complex and difficult to maintain.
author: Anonymous
